text: I am trying to implement an HMM using emission matrix as described here. But it is throwing error that there is no method matching Array. Is there any workaround for this ? Am I missing anything here? is HMMBase the standard go to HMM library in Julia?

elements.text: I am trying to implement an HMM using emission matrix as described here. But it is throwing error that there is no method matching Array. Is there any workaround for this ? Am I missing anything here? is HMMBase the standard go to HMM library in Julia?

text:
I've used HMMBase and I think it's very good, but it works a bit differently from most libraries. For the emission you have to provide a vector of Distributions, one per hidden state, that gives you the probability of each observation for that given hidden state.

I think if you just want to specify a matrix you have to use an array of ``DiscreteNonParametric``
distribution, e.g. :

`DiscreteNonParametric(observations, [0, 0.5, 0.5])`
